csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Choppiness Index (CHOP)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Determines if the market is choppy (trading sideways) or trending.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Values near 100: Choppy market.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Values near 0: Trending market.</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Formula uses Log10 of (Sum(TrueRange) / (MaxHigh - MinLow)).</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class ChoppinessIndex
18 {
19 public int Period { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public ChoppinessIndex(int period = 14)
23 {
24 if (period <= 1)
25 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
26 Period = period;
27 }
28​
29 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
30 {
31 Values.Clear();
32 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
33 if (c.Count == 0) return;
34​
35 // Step 1: Calculate True Ranges
36 var tr = new List<decimal>();
37 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
38 {
39 if (i == 0)
40 {
41 tr.Add(c[i].High - c[i].Low);
42 }
43 else
44 {
45 decimal prevClose = c[i - 1].Close;
46 decimal val1 = c[i].High - c[i].Low;
47 decimal val2 = Math.Abs(c[i].High - prevClose);
48 decimal val3 = Math.Abs(c[i].Low - prevClose);
49 tr.Add(Math.Max(val1, Math.Max(val2, val3)));
50 }
51 }
52​
53 // Step 2: Vector Calculation
54 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
55 {
56 if (i < Period - 1)
57 {
58 Values.Add(null);
59 continue;
60 }
61​
62 decimal sumTr = 0;
63 decimal maxH = decimal.MinValue;
64 decimal minL = decimal.MaxValue;
65​
66 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
67 {
68 int idx = i - j;
69 sumTr += tr[idx];
70 if (c[idx].High > maxH) maxH = c[idx].High;
71 if (c[idx].Low < minL) minL = c[idx].Low;
72 }
73​
74 decimal range = maxH - minL;
75
76 if (range == 0)
77 Values.Add(0);
78 else
79 {
80 // Formula: 100 * LOG10( SUM(TR) / (MaxH - MinL) ) / LOG10(Period)
81 double ratio = (double)(sumTr / range);
82 double logRatio = Math.Log10(ratio);
83 double logPeriod = Math.Log10(Period);
84
85 Values.Add((decimal)(100 * logRatio / logPeriod));
86 }
87 }
88 }
89​
90 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
91 {
92 var ci = new ChoppinessIndex(period);
93 ci.Calculate(candles);
94 return ci.Values;
95 }
96 }
97}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (ChoppinessIndex)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Choppiness Index (CHOP).
7//
8// [Core Concepts]
9// 1. Non-Directional Indicator
10// [Why] We want to know the *quality* of the trend, not the direction.
11// [What] Measures "Chaos" (Choppiness) vs "Order" (Trending).
12//
13// 2. Fractal Geometry Logic
14// [Why] Price action can be measured like a coastline distance.
15// [What] Compares "Total Path Length" (Sum of TR) vs "Displacement" (High-Low Range).
16// - High CHOP: Path is long, but displacement is short (zigzagging/sideways).
17// - Low CHOP: Path is short, displacement is long (direct straight line).
18//
19// 3. Formula
20// 100 * Log10(SumTR / Range) / Log10(Period)
21//
22// [Visual]
23//
24// Scenario A (Choppy/Range):
25// ┌─┐ ┌─┐
26// │ └─┘ │ Sum of individual bars (TR) is HUGE.
27// └─────┘ Net Range (MaxH - MinL) is SMALL (height of box).
28// Ratio is Large -> CHOP is High (near 100).
29//
30// Scenario B (Trending):
31// ╱
32// ╱ Sum of individual bars (TR) approx equal to...
33// ╱ Net Range (MaxH - MinL).
34// ╱ Ratio is Small -> CHOP is Low (near 0).
35//
36// =============================================================================
37​
38using System;
39using System.Collections.Generic;
40​
41namespace TechnicalIndicators
42{
43 // =============================================================================
44 // CandleData
45 // =============================================================================
46 public readonly record struct CandleData(
47 DateTime Timestamp,
48 decimal Open,
49 decimal High,
50 decimal Low,
51 decimal Close,
52 long Volume
53 );
54​
55 // =============================================================================
56 // ChoppinessIndex Class
57 // =============================================================================
58 public class ChoppinessIndex
59 {
60 // Properties
61 public int Period { get; }
62 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
63​
64 // Constructor
65 public ChoppinessIndex(int period = 14)
66 {
67 // Log10(1) is 0, which creates division by zero divisor.
68 // Minimum period is 2.
69 if (period <= 1)
70 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be > 1");
71 Period = period;
72 }
73​
74 // =============================================================================
75 // Main Calculate Method
76 // =============================================================================
77 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
78 {
79 Values.Clear();
80 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
81 if (c.Count == 0) return;
82​
83 // -------------------------------------------------------------
84 // Step 1: Pre-calculate True Range (TR) for all candles
85 // [Why] Essential building block for path length.
86 // Formula: Max of (H-L, |H-PrevC|, |L-PrevC|)
87 // -------------------------------------------------------------
88 var tr = new List<decimal>();
89 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
90 {
91 if (i == 0)
92 {
93 // No previous close for first bar
94 tr.Add(c[i].High - c[i].Low);
95 }
96 else
97 {
98 decimal prevClose = c[i - 1].Close;
99 decimal highM = c[i].High;
100 decimal lowM = c[i].Low;
101
102 // The 3 components of TR
103 decimal val1 = highM - lowM;
104 decimal val2 = Math.Abs(highM - prevClose);
105 decimal val3 = Math.Abs(lowM - prevClose);
106​
107 // Find Max
108 tr.Add(Math.Max(val1, Math.Max(val2, val3)));
109 }
110 }
111​
112 // -------------------------------------------------------------
113 // Step 2: Rolling Calculation
114 // -------------------------------------------------------------
115 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
116 {
117 // Verify enough history
118 if (i < Period - 1)
119 {
120 Values.Add(null);
121 continue;
122 }
123​
124 // ---------------------------------------------------------
125 // Step 3: Calculate Inputs for Formula
126 // A. Sum of TRs (Path Length)
127 // B. Range (Displacement = MaxHigh - MinLow)
128 // ---------------------------------------------------------
129 decimal sumTr = 0;
130 decimal maxH = decimal.MinValue;
131 decimal minL = decimal.MaxValue;
132​
133 // Loop through window [i - Period + 1] to [i]
134 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++)
135 {
136 // Accumulate TR
137 sumTr += tr[i - j];
138​
139 // Find Extremes
140 if (c[i - j].High > maxH) maxH = c[i - j].High;
141 if (c[i - j].Low < minL) minL = c[i - j].Low;
142 }
143​
144 decimal range = maxH - minL;
145​
146 // ---------------------------------------------------------
147 // Step 4: Apply Formula
148 // CHOP = 100 * Log10(SumTR / Range) / Log10(Period)
149 // ---------------------------------------------------------
150 if (range == 0)
151 {
152 // If range is 0, price is flat. Ratio is undefined/infinity.
153 // Conventionally return 0 or carry previous, but 0 is safe.
154 Values.Add(0);
155 }
156 else
157 {
158 // Use double for Log math
159 double logRatio = Math.Log10((double)(sumTr / range));
160 double logPeriod = Math.Log10(Period);
161​
162 decimal chop = (decimal)(100 * logRatio / logPeriod);
163 Values.Add(chop);
164 }
165 }
166 }
167​
168 // =============================================================================
169 // Static Wrapper
170 // =============================================================================
171 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
172 {
173 var ci = new ChoppinessIndex(period);
174 ci.Calculate(candles);
175 return ci.Values;
176 }
177 }
178}
python_simple:
1import math
2​
3class ChoppinessIndex:
4 """
5 Choppiness Index
6 100 * Log10( Sum(TR) / Range ) / Log10( Period )
7 """
8 def __init__(self, period=14):
9 self.period = period
10 self.values = []
11​
12 def calculate(self, candles):
13 self.values.clear()
14 if len(candles) == 0: return
15​
16 # 1. True Ranges
17 tr = []
18 for i in range(len(candles)):
19 if i == 0:
20 tr.append(candles[i]['high'] - candles[i]['low'])
21 else:
22 h = candles[i]['high']; l = candles[i]['low']; pc = candles[i-1]['close']
23 tr.append(max(h-l, abs(h-pc), abs(l-pc)))
24​
25 # 2. Chop Calculation
26 for i in range(len(candles)):
27 if i < self.period - 1:
28 self.values.append(None)
29 continue
30
31 sum_tr = sum(tr[i-self.period+1 : i+1])
32
33 window = candles[i-self.period+1 : i+1]
34 max_h = max(c['high'] for c in window)
35 min_l = min(c['low'] for c in window)
36
37 rng = max_h - min_l
38
39 if rng == 0:
40 self.values.append(0.0)
41 else:
42 ratio = sum_tr / rng
43 val = 100 * math.log10(ratio) / math.log10(self.period)
44 self.values.append(val)
45​
46def calculate(candles, period=14):
47 ci = ChoppinessIndex(period)
48 ci.calculate(candles)
49 return ci.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (ChoppinessIndex)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Choppiness Index (CHOP). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Trend vs. Chop
11# Measures whether the market is trending (directional) or choppy (sideways).
12# It does NOT indicate direction, only the *quality* of the trend.
13#
14# 2. Fractal Dimension
15# Based on chaos theory. It compares the sum of True Ranges (length of path)
16# to the High-Low Range (straight line distance).
17# Large Path / Short Distance = Choppy (High Index)
18# Short Path / Long Distance = Trending (Low Index)
19#
20# 3. Range 0-100
21# 100 = Maximum Chop (Sideways)
22# 0 = Maximum Trend (Directional)
23# Common thresholds: >61.8 (Choppy), <38.2 (Trending)
24#
25# =============================================================================
26​
27import math
28​
29​
30# -------------------------------------------------------------
31# Type-Level Explanation: ChoppinessIndex (class)
32#
33# [Why] Encapsulates logic for calculating market "choppiness".
34# [What] Transforms price candles into a 0-100 index.
35# [Who] Trend-following systems to avoid sideways markets.
36# [Where] Heap allocation.
37# -------------------------------------------------------------
38class ChoppinessIndex:
39​
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # Constructor: __init__
42 #
43 # [Why] Validate period.
44 # [What] Default 14 period is standard.
45 # -------------------------------------------------------------
46 def __init__(self, period=14):
47
48 # -------------------------------------------------------------
49 # Logic Step 1: Validation
50 #
51 # [Decision]
52 # Is period valid (> 1)?
53 #
54 # [True Branch: Invalid]
55 # Raise ValueError.
56 #
57 # [False Branch: Valid]
58 # Set property.
59 # -------------------------------------------------------------
60 if period <= 1:
61 raise ValueError("period")
62
63 self.period = period
64 self.values = []
65​
66​
67 # =============================================================================
68 # IPO: calculate
69 # =============================================================================
70 #
71 # [Input]
72 # - candles: list[dict]
73 #
74 # [Process]
75 # 1. Calculate True Range (TR) for all candles.
76 # 2. Sum TR over 'period'.
77 # 3. Find Range (MaxHigh - MinLow) over 'period'.
78 # 4. Apply Logarithmic Formula.
79 #
80 # [Output]
81 # - None (populates self.values).
82 # =============================================================================
83 def calculate(self, candles):
84
85 # -------------------------------------------------------------
86 # Logic Step 1: Reset & Guard
87 # -------------------------------------------------------------
88 self.values.clear()
89 if len(candles) == 0:
90 return
91​
92 # -------------------------------------------------------------
93 # Logic Step 2: Pre-calculate True Range (TR)
94 #
95 # [Why] (Intent)
96 # TR captures the full "length" of one candle's movement,
97 # including gaps from the previous close.
98 #
99 # [How] (Logic)
100 # TR = Max(H-L, |H-PrevC|, |L-PrevC|)
101 # -------------------------------------------------------------
102 tr = []
103 for i in range(len(candles)):
104
105 # -------------------------------------------------------------
106 # Logic Step 2.1: First Candle Handling
107 #
108 # [Decision]
109 # Is it the first candle?
110 # -------------------------------------------------------------
111 if i == 0:
112 tr.append(candles[i]['high'] - candles[i]['low'])
113 else:
114 prev_close = candles[i - 1]['close']
115
116 # -------------------------------------------------------------
117 # Logic Step 2.2: Compute 3 Component Ranges
118 # -------------------------------------------------------------
119 range1 = candles[i]['high'] - candles[i]['low']
120 range2 = abs(candles[i]['high'] - prev_close)
121 range3 = abs(candles[i]['low'] - prev_close)
122
123 tr.append(max(range1, range2, range3))
124​
125 # -------------------------------------------------------------
126 # Logic Step 3: Main Calculation Loop
127 #
128 # [Visual]
129 # Period 14:
130 # SumTR = Sum of 14 TR values (Path length)
131 # Range = MaxHigh - MinLow (Displacement)
132 # -------------------------------------------------------------
133 for i in range(len(candles)):
134
135 # -------------------------------------------------------------
136 # Logic Step 3.1: Wait for sufficient data
137 #
138 # [Condition]
139 # Need 'period' bars.
140 # -------------------------------------------------------------
141 if i < self.period - 1:
142 self.values.append(None)
143 continue
144​
145 # -------------------------------------------------------------
146 # Logic Step 3.2: Sum of True Ranges (The "Walk")
147 #
148 # [Why] (Intent)
149 # Represents the total distance traveled by price.
150 #
151 # [How] (Logic)
152 # Sliding window sum of TR.
153 # -------------------------------------------------------------
154 sum_tr = sum(tr[i - j] for j in range(self.period))
155​
156 # -------------------------------------------------------------
157 # Logic Step 3.3: High-Low Range (The "Displacement")
158 #
159 # [Why] (Intent)
160 # Represents the net distance covered vertically.
161 #
162 # [How] (Logic)
163 # Find highest high and lowest low in the lookback window.
164 # -------------------------------------------------------------
165 max_h = float('-inf')
166 min_l = float('inf')
167
168 for j in range(self.period):
169 # Access current or past candle in window
170 candle = candles[i - j]
171
172 if candle['high'] > max_h:
173 max_h = candle['high']
174 if candle['low'] < min_l:
175 min_l = candle['low']
176​
177 rng = max_h - min_l
178​
179 # -------------------------------------------------------------
180 # Logic Step 3.4: Compute Index
181 #
182 # [Decision]
183 # Handle zero range (flat market).
184 #
185 # [Formula]
186 # 100 * Log10(SumTR / Range) / Log10(Period)
187 #
188 # [Why] (Math)
189 # If SumTR == Range (Straight line), Log10(1) = 0 -> Index 0.
190 # If SumTR is huge vs Range (Zigzag), Index approaches 100.
191 # -------------------------------------------------------------
192 if rng == 0:
193 self.values.append(0)
194 else:
195 # [Visual]
196 # SumTR=20, Range=10, Period=14
197 # log(20/10) = log(2) ≈ 0.301
198 # log(14) ≈ 1.146
199 # CHOP = 100 * 0.301 / 1.146 ≈ 26.2 (Trending)
200 chop = 100 * math.log10(sum_tr / rng) / math.log10(self.period)
201 self.values.append(chop)
202​
203​
204# =============================================================================
205# Static Wrapper Function: calculate
206# =============================================================================
207#
208# [Why]
209# Functional interface.
210#
211# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
212# =============================================================================
213def calculate(candles, period=14):
214 # 1. Instantiation
215 ci = ChoppinessIndex(period)
216​
217 # 2. Execution
218 ci.calculate(candles)
219​
220 # 3. Extraction
221 return ci.values
